sentences.sentence: The Ministry of Defense in Moscow said at least 63 soldiers have been killed in the attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: They were said to have been recently mobilized recruits staying at a technical school, where ammunition was also stored.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russian gas company Gazprom announced that its exports dropped by nearly 50% in 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In a statement, chairman Alexei Miller admitted a major factor in the drop was European countries' decision to wean itself off Russian gas, caused by Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It is Gazprom's lowest export rate since the year 2000.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But despite the setback, it's not all bad news for the company. This new gas field in southern Siberia will be used to supply gas to the Chinese and Indian markets. Asian countries profited from the fall in gas prices, and Gazprom was on hand to provide.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: was on hand to provide. As for many countries in Europe, reducing dependency on Russia is a priority. Finland installed its first liquified natural gas terminal last Wednesday. Germany also in 2022 installed its first terminal, with five more planned in the pipeline.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Thousands of people have been paying their respects to the late Pope Benedict XVI, whose remains are lying in state at St. Peter's Basilica in the Vatican.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The 95-year-old died on New Year's Eve.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Mourners started queuing hours before his body was transferred from the nearby monastery where he passed away.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Benedict was a controversial leader for some, but was revered as a stalwart of traditional Catholic values by others.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He was both a great and humble person. Everybody could understand him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But I would say that it was this. He was not afraid to face the questions of today. He was very open in that regard.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: For me he was an innovator mainly because he was the keeper of what the faith of the church has been for 2000 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Benedick led the Catholic church for eight years before stepping down due to ill health in 2013.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: His body will lie in state for three days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The online reactions to the death of Pope Benedict XVI have been rather mixed. That's largely due to the perception that he could have taken more action against sexual abuse claims that have rocked the church before and during his papal tenure. Take a look at this, for example.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's a statement put out by Snap, a survivors network for people who faced abuse in the church. In it they directly accused the former Pope of being an abuse enabler, saying that Benedict was more concerned about the church's deteriorating image and financial flow than making true amends to victims of abuse. And it's not just alleged claims of impropriety while he was Pope. In this report, commissioned by the church in Munich, put out in 2022, Cardinal Joseph Ratzinger, as the then former Pope was known, was directly implicated in sexual abuse claims for priests that he was responsible for. Now, he's always denied any wrongdoing personally.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: However, it's the scale of some of these allegations that have made people angry online.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The same report notes how at least 497 victims were involved, more than half of whom were between the ages of just 6 to 14.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Now, on the other hand, six to fourteen. Now on the other hand some online have sought to defend the former Pope with starting the process of kicking out or defrocking abusive priests from the church. However for many victims groups firing certain abusive priests is never going to be enough to atone for some of the serious crimes that they committed. For these people Benedict's death is not a moment to remember his life, but is another painful reminder of tragic events.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A senior health official in the UK has warned that an ongoing crisis in the country's national health service

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: is putting up to 500 lives a week at risk. The president of the Royal College of Emergency Medicine, Dr Adrian Boyle, told the British media that the NHS can't carry on in its present situation, which he called unsafe and undignified. Dr Boyle said this winter is likely to be the worst on record for accident and emergency waiting times, as hospitals are hit with rocketing demand driven by flu, COVID and strep A.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Venezuela and Colombia have reopened the last stretch of their shared border that had remained

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: closed for years in a diplomatic dispute. It was partially closed seven years ago and completely blocked in 2019 when Venezuela's leader, Nicolas Maduro, broke off diplomatic ties after Colombia questioned his 2018 re-election, saying it was rigged.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Both the nations hope to restart cross-border trade, which stood at 6.7 billion euros in 2008, but has collapsed since then.

sentences.sentence: euros in 2008 but has collapsed since then. The Brazilian city of Santos is preparing to mourn football legend King Pele.

Born in 1940 as Edson Arantes Donacimiento, Pele was undisputedly one of the world's greatest sports superstars and the only football player in history to win three World Cups in 1958, 1962, and 1970.
